text: (Draught) Pours a clear amber-copper body with a small beige head. Aroma of toffee, toasted grain, and pine. Flavor of caramel, grass, nuts, florals, and pine with a dry, bitter finish.
Smells almost roasty like a stout, but with some very mild notes of yeast and hops. Taste is the same, somewhat surprisingly. Medium body, low carbonation, and light creamy foam.
Tap. Pours clear red Amber, medium beige head, some lacing. Aroma is lots of caramel, hints of smoke, pine, nutty. Flavor is medium sweet, medium bitter, caramel and pine. Medium body. Meh.
Sample. Ruby red with white head. Caramel, floral and citrus attributes. This was a really easy beer to drink.

Draft. Copper beer with a dark cream head. Light citrus aroma. Citrus and light dark malt flavor with light nuttiness and light pine. Medium bodied. Citrus and light caramel lingers with light nuttiness.
draft at brewery, some caramel flavors, then thin. Not much else. Lightly bitter. Very plain but nothing wrong, has its crowd it can appeal to for sure.
On tap at the brewery. Floral notes, herbal hops, light citrus and light caramel/toffee malts. Medium bitterness and minimal sweetness. Smooth and clean.

Solid all the way around. Here, the bar of the game is smooth. Not usually an attribute if this style. Quite nice. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Clear reddish brown pour with small creamy beige head. Aroma of roasted malts, caramel, slightly floral and hops. Taste of caramel malts, slight citrus and hoppy finish. Medium bodied, perfect carbonation, very drinkable, good beer.

Draft - Grains and toasted malts, light hops and a bit of. Nuts. Cloudy orange brown with a rich beige head. Big leafy hops up front with a toasted malts Nd bitter finish. Nice balance between brown nutty and hops.

Draft at brewpub. Beautiful, clear, fiery ruby dark amber. Small to medium creamy beige head, fairly lasting. Hoppy with just enough sweetness. Grapefruit and some pine. So clean and elegant. Medium body. Very soft. Moderate bitter finish. Balanced sweetness. Very nice.
On tap at the brewpub. Comes reddish brown with a small beige head. Aroma of malt, citrus, and floral. Taste is malt, caramel, citrus, and floral. Excellent Amber Ale.

On tap at the brewery. A - pours a mahogany red with an pronounced egg shell white to light tan head that thins to a light skin with good lacing. S - aromas do not overpower. Some light caramel malts and floral accents stand out. There is a slightly dirty and woody character but not much (appropriate for a beer from this brewery). Faint mustiness and muddled citrus. M - light to medium crisp and slightly oily body with a light to medium palate. T - hops and caramel malts are first. Some distant grapefruit that lingers throughout. Middle introduces some floral notes. Ending is dirty and bitter with some intermittent almonds and citrus. All of the flavors are smooth and mild in this beer and transition without much fanfare.

Poured up on tap at Wilderness where it has a clear deep ruby red to amber body that supports a near white head of foam. The aroma is full of hoppy goodness with pine, kind of a grassy resiny slightly earthy note and then roasted malts in the background. The taste comes across with an initial rush of sweet malts and soft yet firm roasted maltiness. It then quickly picks up pine hop flavor and grassiness that grows more and more into pine hop resiny bitterness. This seems to have a bit of a Stone Arrogant Bastard Ale side to it, like a slightly smaller version. I like that. Very nice hoppy Amber.

Light red pour. Nice hop forward aroma, taste with a very slight bitterness. Not normally a style of beer I drink as I would rather just go for a pale ale, but very well made none the less.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at the brewery. Deep red amber in color with a craggy head. Light malty nose with some graham cracker and toasted almonds. A little nutty roastiness hits first on the taste before a moderate, piney bitterness kicks in. Medium body; dry finish. This might be my least favorite of AZWBCs normal lineup, but its still a nice beer, which should speak volumes on the high quality of the beer these guys brew.

Pours a red tint with a off white head. Aromas of malt, citrus, and some floral notes. Flavors of much of the same. I have to admit, this is my least favorite beer Ive had, but none the less, it is still well balanced and refreshing.

Great golden red color. Perfectly clear with a little head.
Great aroma with a little hoppy smell. Perfectly balanced.
Sedona red colored pour, Small off white head. Malty, floral, citrusy and some earth in the aroma. Flavor of citrus and pine hops with a nice dry malt profile to balance. One hell of a tasty brew.

Nice bright red pour. Small, creamy white head. Oranges, grapefruit, caramel, light floral notes in the nose. The flavor is a perfectly balanced citrus and floral hops with a nice dose of pale malts. Superb.
